intro: Didymoglossum erosum, commonly known as the narrowleaf cotton grass, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, pale blue to whitish flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy habitats and is often found in temperate regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces tiny, clustered inflorescences. Didymoglossum erosum is a low-growing plant that plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems.
